title: The new Piltover Story: Progress Day have been unveiled! AND THERE'S A MAP!!!

embed.description: Piltover is a thriving, progressive city whose power and influence is on the rise. It is Valoran's cultural center, where art, craftsmanship, trade and innovation walk hand in hand.

body:
Take a gander at this new story and the GOD DAMN MAP!!!

http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/piltover-progress-day

http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/piltover/medarda-heirloom

Unlikely that there'll be just a plain ol', all in one, just-the-facts-ma'am, style world map in the near future.
######But if players use the more cultural artifact style maps, like the Medarda Heirloom, to piece together information - I can't stop them.

Speaking of Ezreal. Whoever thought to put Piltover right next to Noxus and Shurima was kinda brilliant, makes his character make a lot of sense in that context. 

Interesting that Noxus is actually like their primary customer
I mean Noxus is pretty much the biggest empire on Runeterra currently, so getting in good with them makes a lot of sense for an independent state.

it does. It's also not what people used to expect who saw piltover as 'good' and probably allied with demacia. 

Are you checking out the map closely rn? It actually gives you a pretty good idea of where every major region is located, with a bit of guesswork for targon

I am, and right now I'm wondering particularly about Krexor, both for the Minotaur connections and for the apparent lack of Noxian control there and Kumungra, because if that's anything to go by I'm wondering about the potential Kumungu lore for the future.

Honestly this map is such a great window in to not only geography but culture and the politics/trade of Valoran and the Southern Continent. It's really interesting to examine. So much so I'm neglecting reading Progress Day until I've got my fill of the map.

I'm thinking a more full map might look something like this: http://imgur.com/a/8W2nv

Obviously with the landmasses made up, but the general locations I feel like have to be pretty accurate. Taliyah went from Ionia in the northeast, to Freljord, to cross noxus into Shurima, that tells me the Freljord has to be north of noxus but inaccessible by sea that way, not West. 

This is pretty much just in my head but I think Icathia could be on the edge of Shurima near Kumungra, where a jungle seems likely (Kumundu jungle or whatever it used to be called). It would explain why void creatures like Kha'zix are in a jungle area and not the desert with Rek'sai
Progress day is quite good, id highly make sure you read it  asap. Many interesting tidbits and such.

Just finished it and yeah, definetly interesting. I'm intrigued at the possibilities that culd emerge from it, though I can't say I don't expect Camille and Caitlyn to be lackadaisical in remedying the situation; they're smart women. They'll figure it.

Hopefully.
IIRC we've got Jhin on his way to Piltover as well, for... *something*.
Jhin, Noxus, and Zaun, OH MY!

Are these maps still canon ?

[Freljord](http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/9/94/Freljord_Map.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161020025101)
[Blackmist](http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/2/2d/Black_Mist_Map.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141106011552)

Yes, everything after the Freljord update in 2014 is still canon.
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}

Why is there some Shuriman crests on some city? Was there some united shuriman government before Azir's return? I thought that all cities parts of the old shuriman empire before the collapse currently are just some independent city-states that should have no crest at like Glorft or Aurma.

It even has little corrections and notes and the places Noxus invaded Shurima... so much to go through... Tell the team it's awesome please.
http://i.imgur.com/2tshevd.gif?noredirect
This would be a terrible map for actual navigation.  No latitude markings and the Rhumb lines don't connect.

> [{quoted}](name=Acanthaceae,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=P9Er0iTO,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2016-12-02T11:04:29.120+0000)
>
> This would be a terrible map for actual navigation.  No latitude markings and the Rhumb lines don't connect.

This is less of a trade map that you would bring on a voyage and more of a big-picture planning map used in the office. For example, Medarda would see which routes to take on a voyage that would yield him the best profits during current conditions, based on their relative location and approximate travel time. He might make note of changes, things that aren't sold anymore, etc.
And the Noxian overtaking of Shriman lands, which is notable on one of the Southern listed locations.

Ships don't fly like crows.

(Was that cryptic enough sounding?  I felt like being a little cryptic, but not too much, I hope.)
The Freljord is north, but ships have to take a path over water? Probably some open ocean to the west that lets them go north.

Your cryptic tongue does not fool me
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Well, I can only use medieval sources I'm familiar with as context.  But, there, ship maps are more for showing the rough way to follow tides to reach places.  Things look warped particularly to the modern eye.

That said, most of those either don't have a compass at all, or if they do what is supposed to be north is roughly north of the central point of the map.  It just might be strangely too far west or east because the map maker emphasizes different sections of the path through the water.

So, going by that.  Freljord is West, it just is probably not as directly west as it looks.

Also, the tech in Runeterra is far and away beyond anything in the medieval world, so, there maps should probably be a bit more accurate.

So just me or does this sound like a certain sheriff is getting a visual update?

Augments are chic now.

 {{champion:112}} ¯\\\_(ツ)_/¯
*Now* ?

Way back when, augments were the curious invention of an unstable inventor who made a fuss in Zaun and was laughed out of the College of Techmaturgy.

_Now_, members of well-to-do social circles are gluing metal plates to their face and dressing up gauntlets with glowing fungus.
This actually is really cool idea, if Viktor is like the underappreciated father of augments that are now pervasive throughout Piltover and Zaun.

In other news, Noxus is taking control of lands of Shurima.

... and Minotaurs are alive?

Cause the place is heavily defended, plus their plan is not to outright conquer the place like they do with the smaller less important cities, their plan is to preserve as much of the city as possible while taking control of it for their own benefit.
Woo! Sharjo giving us the updates on these juicy lore updates!

Not in Glorft, Nashramae, Kalamanda, Stonewall, Kumangra, Mudtown, Noldrum or Krexor!
I love the little added detail of what trade goods can be found where, what rulers are in the city, and what nation is ruling there. Those little touches mean a lot when you are creating a world.

Several states are controlled by Noxus, Kalamanda's a part of Shurima, there are several independent states beyond Piltover and Zaun.
